TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed TemplateUsage extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: All of the built-in templates.
Docs.remarks: A good way to understand these is to look at the default templates defined in

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage Bool = int32(1)

Docs.summary: How to ask for a boolean.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage BoolHelp = int32(2)

Docs.summary: What you can enter when entering a bool.
Docs.remarks: Within this template {0} is the current choice if any and {1} is no preference if optional.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage Clarify = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Clarify an ambiguous choice.
Docs.remarks: This template can use {0} to capture the term that was ambiguous.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage Confirmation = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Default confirmation.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage CurrentChoice = int32(5)

Docs.summary: Show the current choice.
Docs.remarks: This is how the current choice is represented as an option. If you change this, you should also change so that what people can type matches what you show.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage DateTime = int32(6)

Docs.summary: How to ask for a .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage DateTimeHelp = int32(7)

Docs.summary: What you can enter when entering a .
Docs.remarks: Within this template {0} is the current choice if any and {1} is no preference if optional.
This template can use {0} to get the current choice or {1} for no preference if field is optional.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage Double = int32(8)

Docs.summary: How to ask for a double.
Docs.remarks: Within this template if numerical limits are specified using , {0} is the minimum possible value and {1} is the maximum possible value.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage DoubleHelp = int32(9)

Docs.summary: What you can enter when entering a double.
Docs.remarks: Within this template {0} is the current choice if any and {1} is no preference if optional. If limits are specified through , then {2} will be the minimum possible value and {3} the maximum possible value.
Within this template, {0} is current choice if any, {1} is no preference for optional and {1} and {2} are min/max if specified.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage EnumManyNumberHelp = int32(11)

Docs.summary: What you can enter when selecting multiple values from a numbered enumeration.
Docs.remarks: Within this template, {0} is the minimum choice. {1} is the maximum choice and {2} is a description of all the possible words.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage EnumManyWordHelp = int32(13)

Docs.summary: What you can enter when selecting mutiple values from an enumeration.
Docs.remarks: Within this template, {2} is a list of the possible values.

Docs.summary: What you can enter when selecting a single value from a numbered enumeration.
Docs.remarks: Within this template, {0} is the minimum choice. {1} is the maximum choice and {2} is a description of all the possible words.

Docs.summary: What you can enter when selecting one value from an enumeration.

Docs.summary: How to ask for one value from an enumeration.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage Feedback = int32(16)

Docs.summary: How to show feedback after user input.
Docs.remarks: Within this template, unmatched input is available through {0}, but it should be wrapped in an optional {?} in \ref patterns in case everything was matched.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype Microsoft.Bot.Builder.FormFlow.TemplateUsage Help = int32(17)

Docs.summary: What to display when asked for help.
Docs.remarks: This template controls the overall help experience. {0} will be recognizer specific help and {1} will be command help.
